results.title: Ankur = The Seedling
results.creator_credit: Shyam Benegal, Freni Variava, Mohan Bijlani and Blaze Film Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Benegal’s first feature, based on his own story, is a subtlely nuanced exploration of the interrelationship between power, ritual, sexuality and violence. The milieu of feudal society in South India is carefully established as the setting for the playing out of power relations in the liaison between the temporarily abandoned wife of a deaf-mute farmhand and the landlord’s son sent to manage the farm. For the son, sexual attraction is linked to the woman’s lack of social status. Yet he is initially restrained by his middle class fear of exposure. From a position of relative anonymity the woman develops a complex response to the son’s presumption.

Credits: Producers, Mohan J. Bijlani, Freni M. Variava ; director, writer, Shyam Benegal ; photography, Govind Nihalani ; music, Vanraj Bhatia.
Cast: Shabana Azmi, Sadhu Meher, Anant Nag, Priya Tendulkar.

results.title: Suru = The Herd
results.creator_credit: Zeki Okten, Yilmaz Guney and Guney Film
results.brief_description:
A nomadic herdsman who has married a woman from a tribe with which his family has an ancient feud, takes a flock of sheep to sell in Ankara. On the way, some sheep die and others are stolen, and in the big city, the man is paid much less by a dealer than he was promised. Finally, his wife dies. Without preaching or sentimentality, the film exposes the hardships and injustices of Turkish society. Like ‘The Enemy’ and ‘Yol’, this film was supervised by Yilmaz Gueney from prison.

Credits: Producer, writer, Yilmaz Gueney ; director, Zeki Okten ; photography, Izzet Akay ; music, Zulfu Livaneli.
Cast: Tarik Akan, Melike Demirag, Tuncel Kurtiz, Levent Inanir, Meral Niron.

results.title: Die Schweizermacher = The Swissmaker
results.creator_credit: Rolf Lyssy, Marcel Hoehn, Ecco, Rex Films and Willora
results.brief_description:
This amusing and trenchant social comedy on ‘becoming Swiss’ stands as one of Switzerland’s most successful films. Two policemen working in the naturalisation section of the government have to assess the suitability of three immigrants applying for Swiss citizenship—an Italian baker, a German doctor and a Yugoslavian ballet dancer. Complications arise when the younger policeman falls in love with the dancer, whose suitablity as a Swiss citizen is under question. Realised with a lighter touch than many other satirical films by Swiss directors that parody Swiss society, the film tends towards slapstick and features restrained performances by character actor Luond and cabaret performer Steinberger, as the two policemen. The opening lecture is influenced by the Swiss-born Jean-Luc Godard.

Credits: Producer, Marcel Hoehn ; director, Rolf Lyssy ; writers, Rolf Lyssy, Christa Maerker ; photography, Fritz E. Maeder ; editing, Georg Janett ; music, Jonas C. Haefeli.
Cast: Walo Luond, Emil Steinberger, Beatrice Kessler, Hilde Ziegler.

results.title: Road movie = Janice
results.creator_credit: Joseph Strick and Laser Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Two thuggish truck drivers making a desperate fast delivery run across the United States, pick up a prostitute as a diversion. When she offers her body in exchange for the ride the woman, beaten and angry from a previous encounter, begins to experience even more of the degradation she was trying to escape. Rejected and scorned, her feelings of self-pity soon evolve into plans of revenge.

Credits: Producer, director, Joseph Strick ; writer, Judith Rascoe ; photography, Don Lenzer ; editing, Sylvia Sarner ; music, Stanley Myers.
Cast: Robert Drivas, Regina Baff, Barry Bostwick, David Bauer, Regina Baff, Joe Pantoliano.

results.title: Die Flambierte frau = A Woman in flames
results.brief_description:
A raw analysis of class, gender and sex, ‘Women in Flames’ centres on Eva, who one day, without warning, walks out of her stultifying middle-class marriage and into the world of high-class prostitution. Soon she begins an intense relationship with Chris, a fellow prostitute. They move in together but tensions emerge as Eva embraces her sexual freedom and sheds her middle-class moral scruples and Chris’s possessive instincts surface. Set almost entirely in fashionable interiors, stylishly photographed, and with music by Peer Raben the film begs comparison with Fassbinder’s work. Yet Van Ackeren’s film lacks Fassbinder’s assured hand. Cool and distanced, his study of a middle and upper class world ruled by money, power, and sex - where the unexpected and bizarre lie just beneath the tranquil surface, hovers uncertainly between voyeurism and social criticism.

Credits: Director, Robert van Ackeren ; writers, Robert van Ackeren, Catherina Zwerenz ; photography, Jurgen Jurges ; editing, Tanja Schmidbauer ; music, Peer Raben.
Cast: Gudrun Landgrebe, Mathieu Carriere, Hanns Zischler, Gabriele Lafari, Matthias Fuchs.

results.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell and David O. Selznick
results.brief_description: Cedric is a spoilt child brought up in Brooklyn in the 1880’s who inherits an English title and finds his life transformed. In his stately family home in England, Cedric wins over his stern grandfather (C. Aubrey Smith). Freddie Bartholomew stars in the title role and is well supported by Dolores Costello as his mother and Mickey Rooney as the bootblack.

results.title: Of human bondage. Rain
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Lewis Milestone, Joseph Schenck, Pandro S. Berman, Art Cinema Corporation, RKO Radio Pictures and United Artists
results.brief_description: Two Somerset Maugham novels, which became classic films are here presented on one video. In “Of human bondage” Bette Davis made her name as a cheap and vulgar cafe waitress who taunts and ridicules a besotted Leslie Howard, as a crippled professor. Joan Crawford stars in “Rain” as the bad girl Sadie Thompson who attracts the fanatic obsessions of a missionary, which leads to her spiritual reformation. Set during an epidemic on South Sea Pago Pago island, the film caused much controversy on its release.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Cromwell, Lewis Milestone, Joseph Schenck, Pandro S. Berman, Art Cinema Corporation, RKO Radio Pictures and United Artists
